intro: Descurainia lemsii, commonly known as yellow rocket, is an annual herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many edible and economically important plants. The plant features slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs and produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a distinctive white or yellowish vein pattern. The plant is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in disturbed soils, making it a common weed in agricultural and natural areas.
